benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/invoiceItems/{invoiceItemId}/tags - Remove tags from invoice item

covered: Valid Deletion: TC01 demonstrates successful removal of all tags.
Non-Existent Resource: TC08 covers 404 when invoice item does not exist.
Invalid invoiceItemId format: TC09 covers 400 for invalid ID format.
Missing required header: TC10 covers 400 for missing X-Killbill-CreatedBy.
Invalid authentication: TC11 covers 401 for invalid/expired token.
Service unavailable: TC12 covers 503 when service is down.
Malformed tagDef values: TC13 covers 400 for invalid tagDef format.
Very large tagDef values: TC14 covers handling of large tagDef inputs (204/413 scenarios).
Input validation and security: TC15 covers XSS/injection attempts in headers.
Partial input invalidity: TC16 covers 400 for partially specified tagDef.
Concurrency/performance: TC17 covers high concurrency performance expectations.
Special characters in comment: TC18 regression scenario addressing special character handling.
Integration-dependent service unavailable: TC19 covers 204/207 depending on design.
Accessibility: TC20 covers accessibility of error messages and documentation.
gaps: Pagination: No tests cover pagination handling for large datasets with many tags.
Rate Limiting: No tests cover rate limiting or throttling of rapid successive DELETE requests.
Caching Behavior: No tests examine caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) or related caching behavior.
Soft Deletes: No explicit test confirms whether deletions are soft or hard in this API flow.
403 Forbidden path: No explicit test ensuring proper 403 when user is authenticated but lacking permissions.
Explicit non-CRUD error scenarios: Some edge cases (e.g., partial failures across integrations) are touched but not exhaustively enumerated beyond TC19.
recommendations: Add pagination-focused tests to verify correct behavior when a invoice item has a very large number of tags (verify pagination behavior or payload limits).
Introduce rate limiting/throttling tests to ensure system stability under burst DELETE requests.
Add tests verifying caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control) and their impact on responses and subsequent requests.
Add explicit soft-delete verification if the system distinguishes soft vs hard deletes for tags.
Include a dedicated 403 test to validate proper forbidden response when a user is authenticated but lacks necessary permissions.
Expand integration tests to simulate partial failures across dependent services and verify final response semantics.
